Author: evvrythingisawesome

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 99,314Chapters: 60/75Kudos: 63

Summary: (Teen Wolf/Stargate Crossover AU continuation)As summer draws to a close, the Littlefield pack continues their long road to recovery. Still reeling from his sister's death and resurrection, Derek returns to his quest for the truth of his lost Hale ancestor; Cora grapples with the consequences of everything that transpired over the summer, including her return from the dead; and Stiles finds new ways to balance the desires of his inner demons with the needs of his pack.

entry.title: True Fate
entry.summary:
Author: Lalaith_Quetzalli

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,582Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 94

Summary: Alan Deaton is a man who’s always known what he wanted: power. He understood from a very young age that it’s those with power that make the rules (or break them without consequence). He even knew exactly how to get that power. That hasn’t stopped him from failing in his plans. Each and every time. It’s almost like the harder he tries, the harder he fails… But he will find a way to succeed, he will, and no Stilinskis will get in the way this time!

entry.title: The Part That Survives
entry.summary:
Author: Joy_peace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,496Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 4

Summary: Years after the events of Season 6B, Beacon Hills has grown quieter. The monsters sleep, the pack has built lives, and Liam Dunbar has learned how to breathe again after losing the person he loved most. But grief is strange in Beacon Hills. It doesn’t fade. It rearranges itself into something sharp, something hungry, something that whispers: What if? Five months after Theo Raeken’s death, strange storms begin forming in the woods. Lights flicker. Trees crack with electricity. Liam dreams of Theo like he’s standing right beside him—until the line between dream and reality blurs violently. Because Theo isn’t dead. Not really. Not anymore. Something dragged him back wrong—half energy, half ghost, half chimera, flickering and unstable—and every time he gets close to Liam, the static under his skin grows worse. The pack rallies. Old bonds strengthen. New ones form. And Liam faces the terrifying truth: loving someone who’s come back from the dead means learning how to hold them together without losing yourself. But Theo didn’t come back for revenge. Or redemption. He came back for Liam.

entry.title: You’re Safe, I’m Here
entry.summary:
Author: Joy_peace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,684Chapters: 11/22Kudos: 16

Summary: The Beacon Hills Preserve had always been quiet in the early evenings, the kind of quiet that hummed in the bones of anyone supernatural. Most people would call it peaceful. Liam Dunbar called it suspicious. He walked a few steps ahead, his eyes flicking between the trees, inhaling like he expected to catch a threat in the damp leaves or the wind. His shoulders were coiled tight—too tight for a patrol that was supposed to be routine. The sun hovered low enough to stain the whole forest with orange and copper. Behind him, Theo Raeken let out a slow, theatrical sigh. “Dunbar,” he said, voice low but full of a patience he very smugly claimed he didn’t have, “you’re clenching your jaw so hard I can hear your molars trying to fuse.”

entry.title: Some place real
entry.summary:
Author: JadeGlade

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,251Chapters: 7/7Kudos: 229

Summary: Fuzzily, he pulls out his phone, scrolling through his contacts before hovering over one particular name. Unable to ignore it any longer he sits up, takes another swig and hits call. It goes straight to voicemail, of course it does. He should hang up, but instead he sighs into the phone after the beep. “I'm - I'm mad at you,” he finally manages to stutter out. orStiles doesn't know what's wrong. He returns from Mexico in a haze, a feeling of regret constantly gnawing at the pit of his stomach. As senior year begins, a darkness seems to be creeping over Beacon Hills, the pack is drifting apart and bodies are starting to pile up, again. Somehow drunk dialling Derek Hale seems like the only solution.

entry.title: Keystone Species
entry.summary:
Author: SpaceflowerGrace

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 62,938Chapters: 10/12Kudos: 134

Summary: They didn't talk much about why Stiles was back in town. His mother had been inordinately proud of that fact she went into labor and delivered Stiles alone in the woods. It was the eighties, she couldn’t exactly call her husband on her cell phone. Stiles was born healthy in the preserve. Scott got hurt. Scott is Stiles to protect. He always has been. Stiles is pissed about quite a few things. “Scott is my fifteen year old cousin! And you hurt him and then left him alone and hurt? What’s wrong with you?” He has gotten very close to Derek’s face. Stiles takes a breath and turns away. Or- what if Stiles was the responsible adult at home?

entry.title: Derek's Person
entry.summary:
Author: ash_mcj

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,092Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 2,931

Summary: Derek didn’t like people—they set him on edge in a way that nobody quite seemed to understand, much to his vexation. They always invited themselves into his space, like they somehow had a right to be there. They touched his clothes, his books, his skin—leaving their scents clinging to things that were supposed to smell like himself. They expected him to talk to them, and never managed to wrap their heads around the notion that he just couldn’t. Words were difficult for him to use most of the time, and despite all efforts to communicate in other ways, people just didn’t understand. But it didn’t matter anyway, because Derek didn’t like people and had no inclination to socialize with them.But Stiles was…different, somehow. He did everything that Derek hated, and more. He intruded into Derek’s space, he rambled constantly, loudly, with flailing arms and fidgeting fingers—and his presence should have driven Derek up the wall, but it didn’t. Stiles didn’t set him on edge, like everyone else did. And maybe most surprising of all, he understood him.[or: reclusive, feral-risk derek hale finds solace in a wild child, much to his pack’s surprise](previously titled "Stiles Stilinski")

entry.title: the shape of being chosen
entry.summary:
Author: sourwolf97

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,808Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 28

Summary: Derek huffs, the softest hesitation of a laugh, warm against his skin. “You talk in your sleep,” he counters quietly. “A lot.” Panic flickers up his spine before Stiles can stop it. He forces his voice to stay light, easy. “It’s probably just my soul trying to escape my body,” he says. “Can’t blame it, really.” But inside, he’s scrolling through mental footage of every night he’s ever crashed here, cataloguing every murky, half-remembered dream, wondering what words might have slipped out when his guard was down. Did he say Derek’s name? Did he say I love you? Did he say don’t leave? Did he confess the whole pathetic thesis statement his brain has been footnoting for months now: I know this isn’t actually anything for you, and that’s fine, I’m fine, please just let me keep pretending until you get bored?

entry.title: My Target
entry.summary:
Author: StarStruckFears

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,367Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 15

Summary: Stiles was a monster, his mother had said so, screamed it even. So he does the only thing he can to save his parents from the monster he is. Stiles runs and finds a new home, one of death, one deserving of a monster. Aka Stiles is raised by the Argents and is sent with Allison to finish the mission Kate had failed to complete. Though neither hunter had expected to get so attached to the pack of monsters they are trained to kill.
